video.title: We the Economy
video.synopsis: Using animation, music, comedy and more, 20 acclaimed filmmakers demystify important aspects of the economy in this engaging collection of shorts.

seasons.title: We the Economy: 20 Short Films You Can't Afford to Miss

episodes.synopsis: Three enterprising cave men accidentally invent trade, marketing and the base elements of the modern financial system. Directed by Morgan Spurlock.
episodes.title: Cave-o-nomics

episodes.synopsis: Two bored students go on a whimsical adventure in this tale of love, dance and the economic concept of supply and demand. Directed by Jon M. Chu.
episodes.title: Supply and Dance, Man!

episodes.synopsis: Economists John Maynard Keynes and Friedrich Hayek wage a testosterone-fueled battle over how to measure the economy. Directed by Chris Henchy.
episodes.title: GDP Smackdown

episodes.synopsis: A businessman and a 10-year-old girl wage a battle of lemonade stands to illustrate how government regulates the economy. Directed by Ramin Bahrani.
episodes.title: Lemonade War

episodes.synopsis: Ensuring the future of our economy depends on not taking our most important resource -- nature -- for granted. Directed by Adrian Grenier.
episodes.title: A Bee's Invoice: The Hidden Value in Nature

episodes.synopsis: When Federal Reserve Chairman Rob Rafaelson wakes with amnesia, he gets a refresher course using children's toys. Directed by Catherine Hardwicke.
episodes.title: Fed Head

episodes.synopsis: You think that a dollar bill is money and that banks are where your cash is stored and safeguarded. You're wrong. Directed by James Schamus.
episodes.title: That Film About Money

episodes.synopsis: How does money get from the Federal Reserve into circulation? The answer's not quite what you might expect. Directed by James Schamus.
episodes.title: The Second Part of That Film About Money

episodes.synopsis: What causes a recession? While certain economic problems are undeniable, two human factors can make it worse: fear and greed. Directed by Lee Hirsch.
episodes.title: Recession

episodes.synopsis: Take a trip to the New York Stock Exchange to learn how Wall Street influences the economy and impacts our lives. Directed by Joe Berlinger.
episodes.title: The Street

episodes.synopsis: Why is our tax system so complicated? With retro flair, this cartoon explains how our tax system does -- and doesn't -- work. Directed by Jessica Yu.
episodes.title: Taxation Nation

episodes.synopsis: This free-wheeling animated film explains how Congress and public officials use and manage debt, for good and for bad. Directed by Marshall Curry.
episodes.title: An Animated Film on the Debt & the Deficit

episodes.synopsis: Uncle Sam takes a cut of our earnings every April. But where does our hard-earned money go? The answers will surprise you. Directed by Barbara Kopple.
episodes.title: Your Tax Dollars at Work

episodes.synopsis: U.S. foreign aid often benefits American businesses, but isn't always good for the countries who receive it. Directed by Rachel Grady and Heidi Ewing.
episodes.title: The Foreign Aid Paradox

episodes.synopsis: Experts explain the globalized economy and the global trade system while a troupe of comedic actors enlivens the commentary. Directed by Bob Balaban.
episodes.title: Globalization ... Who Cares? You Do

episodes.synopsis: With its massive loss of manufacturing jobs, Detroit has been emblematic of a nationwide trend. How can a city bounce back? Directed by Albert Hughes.
episodes.title: City on the Rise

episodes.synopsis: Interconnected narratives provide a nuanced perspective on China's economic boom and its promising impact on the U.S. economy. Directed by Miao Wang.
episodes.title: Made by China in America

episodes.synopsis: Global trade clearly benefits our economy. But can we consume cheap imported products without exploiting someone else? Directed by Jehane Noujaim.
episodes.title: Supply Chain Reaction

episodes.synopsis: In a magical land full of multicolored alpacas, there's a vast divide in wealth distribution. What's behind the inequality? Directed by Adam McKay.
episodes.title: The Unbelievably Sweet Alpacas!

episodes.synopsis: Different views on the causes of inequality and ways to reverse this destabilizing trend on our economy are explored. Directed by Shola Lynch.
episodes.title: Monkey Business aka Economic Inequality

episodes.synopsis: Why is minimum wage important? Heated debate over increasing it centers on the passing of $15-an-hour legislation in Seattle. Directed by Steve James.
episodes.title: The Value of Work

episodes.synopsis: A hapless patient journeys through the labyrinth of U.S. health care and is left with a headache and sticker shock. Directed by Mary Harron.
episodes.title: This Won't Hurt a Bit!

episodes.synopsis: The lethal Ebola outbreak of 2014 -- the largest in history -- serves as a case study for how pandemics can impact the global economy.
episodes.title: The Ebola Economy
